lines.content: * The main body of the ChatBot Kyrene. It initialises from loading a file to get existing tasks,
* and then interacts with user to manage the to-do list.
* Initialise Kyrene with loading file from the specified file path.
* If the file does not exist, then create one.
* Run Kyrene to interact with user.
* Exit when user commands to exit.
* Main function to initialise and run Kyrene.
* Represents a command that consists a main command word,
* possibly a description or task number to describe the target of the command,
* and an exit flag to indicate whether to exit the programme or not.
* Construct a command of BYE or LIST, otherwise INVALID command.
* Construct a command of MARK, UNMARK, or DELETE, otherwise INVALID command.
* Construct a command of ADD, AT, DUE ,or FIND, otherwise INVALID command.
* Returns the exit flag indicating whether to exit the programme.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* @param storage A storage object to read and write to specific file.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Storage storage) {
* Handle the invalid command error by displaying the error message.
* Handle the BYE command by displaying exit message.
* Handle LIST command by listing all tasks within the task list.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* Handle MARK command by marking the specified task in the task list
* as done or not done depending on the input.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* @param storage A storage object to read and write to specific file.
* @param isDone True for marking as done, otherwise marking as not done.
private void handleMark(TaskList tasks, Storage storage, boolean isDone)
* Handle ADD command by adding the input task into the task list.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* @param storage A storage object to read and write to specific file.
private void handleAdd(TaskList tasks, Storage storage)
* Handle DELETE command by deleting the specified task in the task list.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* @param storage A storage object to read and write to specific file.
private void handleDelete(TaskList tasks, Storage storage)
* Handle AT command by searching and listing out all events in the task list
* that happen at the specified time.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* Handle DUE command by searching and listing out all deadlines in the task list
* that due before the specified time.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* Handle FIND command by searching and listing out all tasks in the task list
* that match with the key word.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* Represents a collection of all possible kinds of commands.
BYE, LIST, ADD, DELETE, MARK, UNMARK, AT, DUE, FIND, INVALID,
* Deals with making sense of the user command.
* For example, converting user input strings to command-type objects, or to dates and times.
* Returns Command-type object converted from the input string.
* If the command is invalid, then throws exceptions to indicate that the input is invalid.
* @param sentence single line string to be parsed.
* @throws NumberFormatException If letters from the string cannot be converted to integers.
* @throws ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException If the string is an invalid command that only contains one or zero word.
* @throws StringIndexOutOfBoundsException If the string is an invalid command.
* that only contains the command word but no descriptions.
public static Command parse(String sentence) throws NumberFormatException, ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException, StringIndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Returns a word indicating the type of the task from the input string.
* @param sentence single line string to be parsed.
* @return String indicating the type of the task.
* Returns a date from the input string.
* If the string is not formatted properly, it requires another input of correct format.
* @param sentence single line string to be parsed.
* Returns a date with time from the input string.
* If the string is not formatted properly, it tries to parse with date only.
* @param sentence single line string to be parsed.
* Returns a date with appended time of 2359 from the input string that only contains date information.
* If the string is not formatted properly, it tries to parse with time only.
* @param sentence single line string to be parsed that only contains date information.
* Returns today's date with time from the input string that only contains time information.
* If the string is not formatted properly, it requires another input of correct format.
* @param sentence single line string to be parsed that only contains time information.
* Represents a storage object that is used to read from and write to the file provided specific file path.
* Construct a storage object with file path and folder path of the target file.
* @param filePath String represents the path of the target file.
* @param folderPath String represents the path of the folder that stores the target file.
* Set the file path of the target file with the input string.
* @param filePath String represents the path of the target file.
* Set the folder path of folder that store the target file with the input string.
* @param folderPath String represents the path of the target file.
* Returns the string representing the file path of the target file.
* @return The path of the target file.
* Returns the string representing the path of the folder that stores the target file.
* @return The path of the folder that stores the target file.
* Write the entire task list to the target file.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* @throws IOException If an error relating to file access occurs.
public void write(TaskList tasks) throws IOException {
* Read the existing task list from the target file.
* @return A task list containing all existing tasks loaded from the target file.
* @throws FileNotFoundException If the target file is not found by the given file path.
* Create file under the given file path,
* and create folder if folder under the given folder path does not exist.
* Load a single task into the task list.
* @param sentence String containing all information of the task being loaded.
* @param isDone Indicates the done status of the task. True for done, otherwise not done.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
* @throws KyreneInvalidCommandException If the file has been corrupted.
* @throws KyreneMissingTaskException If the file has been corrupted.
public void loadTask(String sentence, boolean isDone, TaskList tasks) throws KyreneInvalidCommandException, KyreneMissingTaskException {
* Represents a deadline task that contains task type as "D", task name,
* done status, and a specific deadline.
protected static DateTimeFormatter formatterInput = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
protected static DateTimeFormatter formatterOutput = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("HH:mm MMM dd yyyy");
* Construct a deadline task with a string that contains task name and deadline.
* If deadline information is missing, then throws KyreneMissingTimeException.
* @param line String that contains task name and deadline.
* @throws KyreneMissingTimeException If deadline information is missing.
* Returns a string representing deadline date and time of the task.
* @return String representing deadline date and time.
* Set deadline date and time for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it tries to set deadline with date only.
* @param deadline String that contains date and time information.
* Set deadline date and time of 2359 for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it tries to set deadline with time only.
* @param deadline String that contains date information.
* Set deadline as today's date and time for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it requires another input of correct format.
* @param deadline String that contains date and time information.
* Returns true if input time is before deadline, otherwise returns false.
* @param time String that contains date and time information.
* @return True if input time is before deadline, otherwise false.
* Returns a string representing the deadline task that is used for output purpose.
* @return A string representing the deadline task.
return String.format("[%s][%s] %s (by %s)", taskType, doneSymbol, taskName, getDeadline());
* Returns a string representing the deadline task that is used for storage purpose.
* @return A string representing the deadline task.
public String format() { return String.format("%b deadline %s /by %s\n", isDone, taskName, deadline.format(formatterInput));}
* Represents an event task that contains task type as "E", task name,
* done status, and a specific start time and end time.
protected static DateTimeFormatter formatterInput = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd HHmm");
protected static DateTimeFormatter formatterOutput = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("HH:mm MMM dd yyyy");
* Construct an event task with a string that contains task name and time information.
* If time information is missing, then throws KyreneMissingTimeException.
* @param line String that contains task name and time information.
* @throws KyreneMissingTimeException If start time or end time information is missing.
* Returns a string representing start date and time of the task.
* @return String representing start date and time.
* Returns a string representing end date and time of the task.
* @return String representing end date and time.
* Set start date and time for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it tries to set start time with date only.
* @param startTime String that contains date and time information.
* Set start date and time of 0000 for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it tries to set start time with time only.
* @param startTime String that contains date information.
* Set start date as today's date and time for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it requires another input of correct format.
* @param startTime String that contains time information.
* Set end date and time for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it tries to set end time with date only.
* @param endTime String that contains date and time information.
* Set end date and time of 0000 for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it tries to set end time with time only.
* @param endTime String that contains date information.
* Set end date as today's date and time for the task.
* If the string format is invalid, it requires another input of correct format.
* @param endTime String that contains time information.
* Returns true if input date is within the event duration, otherwise returns false.
* @param date String that contains date information.
* @return True if input date is within the event duration, otherwise false.
* Returns a string representing the event task that is used for output purpose.
* @return A string representing the event task.
return String.format("[%s][%s] %s (from: %s to: %s)", taskType, doneSymbol, taskName, getStartTime(), getEndTime());
* Returns a string representing the event task that is used for storage purpose.
* @return A string representing the event task.
return String.format("%b event %s /from %s /to %s\n", isDone, taskName, start, end);
* Represents a task that contains task type as null, task name,
* Construct a to-do task with a string that contains task name.
* @param taskName String that contains task name.
* Returns a string representing task name.
* Returns the done status of the task, true for done, otherwise not done.
* Returns a string representing start date and time of the task.
* @param taskName String representing the task name.
* Set the done status of the task, true for done, otherwise not done.
* @param isDone Done status of the task.
* Returns an upper-case character representing the task type.
* Returns a string representing the task that is used for output purpose.
* Returns a string representing the task that is used for storage purpose.
public String format() { return String.format("%b task %s\n", isDone, taskName);}
* Represents an event task that contains task type as "T", task name,
* Construct a to-do task with a string that contains task name.
* @param taskName String that contains task name.
* Returns a string representing the to-do task that is used for storage purpose.
* @return A string representing the to-do task.
public String format() { return String.format("%b todo %s\n", isDone, taskName);}
* Represents a task type array list.
* Contains all class level methods that deal with user input and system output.
private final static String HELLO = "    Hi, I am Kyrene, your private reminder assistant.\n"
+ "    What can I do for you?\n";
private final static String BYE = "    Bye! Wish to see you again soon!\n";
private final static String ERROR_WRITE_TO_FILE_FAILED = "    Error! Write to file failed.\n";
private final static String ERROR_FOLDER_CREATION_FAILED = "    Error! Folder creation failed.\n";
private final static String ERROR_FILE_CREATION_FAILED = "    Error! File creation failed.\n";
private final static String ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED = "    Error! File loaded is corrupted.\n";
private final static String ERROR_TASK_NOT_EXIST = "    Error! This task does not exist.\n";

private final static String ERROR_MISSING_TASK = "    Error! Your task description is missing.
    For creating tasks, please type "[task type (todo/deadline/event)] [task description]"([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        todo have a nice day
    or
        deadline get a cup of coffee /by 2024-02-29 0900
    or
        event celebrate birthday /from 2024-10-27 1700 /to 2359
";

private final static String ERROR_MISSING_TIME = "    Error! Your deadline/event task created is incomplete in terms of time.
    For creating deadline task, please type "deadline [task description] /by [time]"([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        deadline get a cup of coffee /by 2024-02-29 0900
    For creating event task, please type "event [task description] /from [starting time] /to [ending time]"([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        event celebrate birthday /from 2023-10-27 1700 /to 2359
";

private final static String ERROR_INVALID_COMMAND = "    Error! This command is invalid. Some available commands are ([] is to be omitted):
        list
        mark [task index]
        unmark [task index]
        delete [task index]
        [task type (todo/deadline/event)] [task description]
        due [due time] (to check which deadlines before the given time)
        at [date] (to check which events at the given date)
        find [keyword]
        bye
";

private final static String ERROR_INVALID_DDL_TIME_FORMAT = "    Error! The format of input deadline date and time is invalid.
    Please re-enter the time of deadline as [Year-Month-Date HourMinute]([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        2024-02-29 0900
        2024-02-29
        0900
";

private final static String ERROR_INVALID_EVENT_START_TIME_FORMAT = "    Error! The format of input event start date and time is invalid.
    Please re-enter the start time of event as [Year-Month-Date HourMinute]([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        2024-02-29 0900
        2024-02-29
        0900
";

private final static String ERROR_INVALID_EVENT_END_TIME_FORMAT = "    Error! The format of input event end date and time is invalid.
    Please re-enter the end time of event as [Year-Month-Date HourMinute]([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        2024-02-29 0900
        2024-02-29
        0900
";

private final static String ERROR_INVALID_DATE_FORMAT = "    Error! The format of input date is invalid.
    Please re-enter the date as [Year-Month-Date]([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        2024-02-29
";

private final static String ERROR_INVALID_TIME_FORMAT = "    Error! The format of input time is invalid.
    Please re-enter the time as [Year-Month-Date HourMinute]([] is to be omitted).
    For example:
        2024-02-29 0900
        2024-02-29
        0900
";
* Show a line of divider on the screen.
* Show welcome message on the screen.
* Show exit message on the screen.
* Show task count message on the screen.
* @param taskCount Integer represents the total number of tasks in the task list.
System.out.printf("    Now you have %d task(including finished ones) in your list.\n\n", taskCount);
System.out.printf("    Now you have %d tasks(including finished ones) in your list.\n\n", taskCount);
* Show number of matches under search commands on the screen.
* @param matchCount Integer represents the total number of matches in the task list.
System.out.printf("    You have %d matched task in your list.\n\n", matchCount);
System.out.printf("    You have %d matched tasks in your list.\n\n", matchCount);
* Show error message on the screen, relating to missing time information
* Show error message on the screen, relating to failure writing to the target file.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to accessing non-existing task index.
* @param taskCount Integer represents the total number of tasks in the task list.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to missing task description when creating task.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to input command not being recognised.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to the corrupted target file.
* @param lineNumber Integer indicating the line number of the corrupted line in the target file.
System.out.printf("%s    Error occurs at line %d.\n", ERROR_FILE_CORRUPTED, lineNumber);
* Show error message on the screen, relating to non-existing file under the given file path.
* @param filePath String representing the file path of the target file.
System.out.printf("    File %s is not found. Trying to create file...\n", filePath);
* Show error message on the screen, relating to non-existing folder under the given folder path.
* @param folderPath String representing the folder path of the folder that stores the target file.
System.out.printf("    Folder %s is not found. Trying to create folder...\n", folderPath);
* Show error message on the screen, relating to failure creating the target file.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to failure creating the target folder.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to the input date format being not recognised.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to the input time format being not recognised.
* Show error message on the screen, relating to the input deadline format being not recognised.

* Show error message on the screen, relating to the input event end time format being not recognised.
* Show success in task creation message on the screen.
* @param taskCount Integer representing the total number of tasks in the task list.
public static void showSuccessAddingTask(String task, int taskCount) {
System.out.printf("    Task has been successfully added: %s\n", task);
* Show success in task deletion message on the screen.
* @param taskCount Integer representing the total number of tasks in the task list.
public static void showSuccessDeletingTask(String task, int taskCount) {
System.out.printf("    Sure! I have successfully deleted this task from your list:\n        %s\n", task);
* Show success in task marking message on the screen.
* @param taskNumber Integer representing the index of the marked task.
* @param isDone Done status of the marked task.
public static void showSuccessMarkingTask(int taskNumber, boolean isDone) {
System.out.printf("    Congrats! Task %d is done!\n\n", taskNumber);
System.out.printf("    Task %d is marked as not done.\n\n", taskNumber);
* Show success in loading file message on the screen.
* @param filePath String representing the file path of the target file.
System.out.printf("    File %s has been loaded.\n", filePath);
* Show success in folder creation message on the screen.
* @param folderPath String representing the folder path of the folder that stores the target file.
System.out.printf("    Folder %s is successfully created.\n", folderPath);
* Show success in file creation message on the screen.
* @param filePath String representing the file path of the target file.
System.out.printf("    File %s is successfully created.\n", filePath);
* List out all tasks and show the total number of tasks in the task list on the screen.
* @param tasks A task list containing all existing tasks.
System.out.println("    Here is your to-do list of required tasks:");
* List out all matched events and show the total number of events in the event list on the screen.
* @param events An event list containing all matched events.
System.out.println("    Here is your event list that matches the given date:");
* List out all matched deadlines and show the total number of deadlines in the deadline list on the screen.
* @param deadlines A deadline list containing all matched events.
System.out.println("    Here is your deadline list before the given time:");
* List out all matched tasks and show the total number of matches in the task list on the screen.
* @param matches A task list containing all matched events.
System.out.println("    Here is your to-do list that matches the given keyword:");
* Show the status of loading file on the screen.
* Read a line of command from the user input.
